channel.title: BBC News - Northern Ireland
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Covid-19: Vaccine complacency warning over Covid deaths
item.description: A senior GP warns of the dangers of a "can't be bothered" attitude towards getting a Covid jab.

item.title: Vaccine passport: Almost 300 fraudulent claims rejected
item.description: The Department of Health says the system is now "stable and running well".

item.title: Belfast Glider: Decision time for planned new routes
item.description: How can new rapid transit routes in Belfast best serve the city's population?

item.title: Communions and confirmations to resume, Bishop of Raphoe says
item.description: The Bishop of Raphoe is the fifth Irish bishop to say communions and confirmations will restart.

item.title: Coronavirus: First people arriving into UK after rules relaxed for fully jabbed
item.description: People vaccinated in the EU or US do not need to isolate when coming to the UK from an amber country.

item.title: Belfast Mater Hospital nurse has car hijacked after night shift
item.description: A woman and a man are targeted in separate hijackings near Belfast's Mater Hospital this weekend.

item.title: Covid-19: Five more deaths and 1,072 new coronavirus cases
item.description: The total number of Covid-19 vaccines administered in Northern Ireland is now 2,262,641.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: The NI athletes in action in the second week of the Games
item.description: Of the 31 Northern Irish athletes to be selected to compete at the Tokyo Olympics, only six remain in competition in the days to come

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: 'I had a little niggle' - Ciara Mageean misses out in 1500m heats
item.description: Ireland's 1500m hopeful Ciara Mageean is out of the Tokyo Olympics after finishing 10th in her heat, as Sarah Healy and Phil Healy also fail to progress.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Rhys McClenaghan seventh in men's pommel horse final
item.description: Rhys McClenaghan suffers Olympic heartbreak as a dismount early in his routine saw him finish seventh in the men's pommel horse final

item.title: 'We'll be back better' - GB captain Ames after hockey exit
item.description: Team GB's men's hockey player David Ames tells BBC Sport that the squad will come back 'better and stronger' after their Tokyo 2020 quarter-final defeat to India.

item.title: Tokyo 2020: Rory McIlroy says Olympics not just another tournament after missing out on medal
item.description: Rory McIlroy admits his perception of participating in the Olympic Games has changed after missing out on a medal in the men's golf tournament in Tokyo.

item.title: Covid-19: Are NI's young people resisting the vaccine?
item.description: Why do vaccination numbers among the under-30s in Northern Ireland remain relatively low?

item.title: Q&A: Getting jabbed after NI vaccination centres close for first jabs
item.description: Saturday is the last day to get your first dose of a Covid jab at NI's mass vaccination centres.

item.title: Covid-19: NI vaccination passport service back in action
item.description: People travelling on Sunday should get an email inviting them to download a certificate, say officials.

item.title: Covid-19: Nisra records increase in NI's virus-related deaths
item.description: Nine deaths were registered in the week up to last Friday, a rise of six from the previous week.

item.title: Covid-19: NI Executive to relax travel isolation rules
item.description: Vaccinated EU and US travellers coming to Northern Ireland will not need to quarantine from 2 August.

item.title: Covid-19: Where are Covid-19 vaccine clinics in NI?
item.description: Anyone aged 18 can now get a coronavirus jab at walk-in centres across Northern Ireland.

item.title: Donaghadee: Harbour time capsule recovery could cost £720k
item.description: There is a debate about the exact location of the time capsule buried at the County Down town's harbour.

item.title: Ulster Football Final: Seagulls swoop to see Tyrone triumph at Croke Park as Farney fightback falls just short
item.description: A colony of seagulls joined the 18,000 fans in being enthralled by the Ulster Final at Croke Park as Tyrone held off Monaghan's stirring comeback.

item.title: Cork: How sheep and goats uncovered hidden headstones
item.description: More than 500 graves thought lost forever have been uncovered by volunteers - both animal and human.

item.title: School uniforms: Should schools face a price limit?
item.description: From blazers to branded PE kits, the annual back-to-school bill can leave some families in debt.

item.title: Latest Northern Ireland weather forecast
item.description: The weather forecast in Northern Ireland.

item.title: Pensioner Olympian Mike Bull still pole vaulting at 74
item.description: Mike Bull is a double Commonwealth gold medallist and Olympic finalist in the sport.

item.title: Belfast: Archaeology students stumble across Neolithic find
item.description: The QUB students were looking for 18th and 19th century artefacts in Stranmillis in south Belfast.

item.title: Bank of Ireland harassment case 'shows employers must protect women'
item.description: Natasha McNicholl says it was two years after she won a sexual harassment case that an anonymity order was lifted.

item.title: NI abortion: Givan 'will resist' government order to Stormont
item.description: The first minister is taking legal advice and is prepared to go to court to block abortion services.

item.title: Derry City beat Longford to move into sixth
item.description: Derry City beat Longford Town 2-0 in Saturday night's Premier Division game at Bishopsgate to move into sixth place in the table.

item.title: Londonderry: Man taken to hospital after stabbing
item.description: The man was found with injuries to his neck in the early hours of Thursday morning.

item.title: North west floods support scheme opens for farmers
item.description: The £2.7m scheme opens almost four years since record rainfall fell on the north west.

item.title: New exhibition explores life along Derry-Donegal border
item.description: The production, entitled Borderlands, will feature interviews from 22 people living in border areas.

item.title: Covid-19: 10,000 vaccinated at walk-in centres in Republic of Ireland
item.description: About two thirds of those vaccinated on Saturday were under 19, the health service chief says.

item.title: All-Ireland GAA finals to host 40,000 fans
item.description: The All-Ireland football and hurling finals will be played in front of 40,000 spectators at Croke Park

item.title: Rowers win Ireland's first gold at Tokyo Olympics
item.description: Ireland win their first gold medal of the Tokyo 2020 Olympic Games as Paul O'Donovan and Fintan McCarthy claim the lightweight men's double sculls.

item.title: Covid-19: Irish PM says no jab needed to return to office
item.description: Micheál Martin also praised the country's vaccine roll-out for being "way ahead" of EU averages.

item.title: Irish Sea rescue after man spends 10 hours in water
item.description: The man is "stressed but stable" after his ordeal in the Irish Sea off the coast of County Louth.
